description: You want the equivalent of chopped meat, not a meat purée The finer you grind the meat, the more likely you are to pack it together too tightly, which will make the burger tough Handle the meat gently
title: Inside-Out Lamb Cheeseburgers
title_page: Inside-Out Lamb Cheeseburgers Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
You want the equivalent of chopped meat, not a meat purée. The finer you grind the meat, the more likely you are to pack it together too tightly, which will make the burger tough.
Handle the meat gently. Make the patties with a light hand, and don’t press on them with a spatula, like a hurried short-order cook.
Featured in: For The Love Of A Good Burger.
Learn: How to Grill
Learn: How to Make Burgers
